summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between FBI Victim Services Division personnel, DOJ officials, and others, coordinating the distribution of invitations and RSVP questionnaires for a meeting (likely a victim briefing) related to the Epstein case. It reveals the logistical efforts to contact victims and their attorneys.

connections.description: Both are listed as attorneys from the same firm, Allred Maroko Goldberg, representing victims in the Epstein case.
Both are listed as attorneys from the same firm, Edwards Pottinger, representing victims in the Epstein case.
Both are listed as attorneys from the same firm, Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, representing victims in the Epstein case.
The FBI is coordinating with attorney Gloria Allred to contact victims for a briefing meeting.

events.title: Planned Victim Briefing Meeting
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for November 12, 2020, for which the FBI and DOJ were sending out invitations and RSVP questionnaires to victims and their attorneys.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division and DOJ were actively coordinating a victim briefing meeting related to the Epstein case in late October 2020.
Invitations were sent to 14 attorneys (with requests to pass to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
The document lists 17 named attorneys from prominent law firms (Allred Maroko Goldberg, Edwards Pottinger, Boies Schiller Flexner LLP) representing Epstein victims.
Logistical challenges included reaching victims with no direct contact information and managing multiple attorneys for single victims.
The correspondence shows inter-agency coordination (FBI, DOJ/CRT, ODAG) and careful clearance processes for official communications with victims.
